skill.name: browser-testing-with-screenshots
skill.description: Use when testing web applications with visual verification - automates Chrome browser interactions, element selection, and screenshot capture for confirming UI functionality
skill.summary: Use when testing web applications with visual verification - automates Chrome browser interactions, ...
skill.author: AgentWorkforce

security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation skill containing only markdown instructions for browser automation. No executable code, scripts, or network calls exist in the skill itself. Static findings flagged standard bash scripting patterns (command substitution, shell invocation) and external tool references, but these are legitimate browser testing practices. The actual browser automation tools (browser-start.js, browser-screenshot.js) must be installed separately from agent-tools repository.

content.user_title: Automate browser testing with visual verification
content.value_statement: Manual browser testing is time-consuming and error-prone. This skill provides automated Chrome browser control through DevTools Protocol for reliable UI verification and screenshot capture.
actual_capabilities: Launch Chrome with remote debugging for automation
Navigate to URLs and wait for page load
Capture screenshots of current viewport state
Execute JavaScript in page context for interaction
Extract page content and element selectors
limitations: Requires separate installation of agent-tools from GitHub
Cannot test pages behind authentication without credentials
Screenshots capture only current viewport, not full page

use_cases.title: Verify UI Changes
use_cases.description: Test localhost applications by capturing screenshots before and after code changes to catch visual regressions.

use_cases.title: Visual Test Documentation
use_cases.description: Automate end-to-end test scenarios and capture screenshot evidence for test reports and bug documentation.

use_cases.title: Document Workflows
use_cases.description: Generate step-by-step visual guides by automating browser navigation and capturing screenshots at each step.

prompt_templates.title: Start Browser
prompt_templates.prompt: Start a fresh Chrome browser instance with remote debugging for testing.

prompt_templates.title: Navigate and Screenshot
prompt_templates.prompt: Navigate to http://localhost:5172/dashboard and take a screenshot to verify the page loaded correctly.

prompt_templates.title: Form Interaction Test
prompt_templates.prompt: Navigate to the login page, fill in the username and password fields using browser evaluation, click the login button, and verify the dashboard loads with a screenshot.

prompt_templates.title: Visual Regression Check
prompt_templates.prompt: Navigate to the settings page, take a baseline screenshot, make a change, take another screenshot, and compare the visual differences.

output_examples.input: Test the login flow by navigating to the login page, taking a screenshot, filling in test credentials, submitting, and capturing the dashboard.
output: Browser started with fresh profile on port 9222
Clicked login button via element selector
Login flow test complete - 2 screenshots captured

output_examples.input: Verify the settings page loads correctly and check for any console errors.

best_practices: Add sleep delays after navigation to ensure page content fully loads before screenshots
Use browser-pick.js for element selection instead of hardcoded CSS selectors
Start browser with --fresh flag only when clean state is needed; use default profile to preserve login sessions
anti_patterns: Skipping sleep delays after navigation results in screenshots of loading states
Hardcoding CSS selectors causes tests to break when UI components change
Not checking browser connection before running tests leads to confusing error messages

faq.question: Which browsers are supported?
faq.answer: This skill works with Chrome and any Chromium-based browser that supports the DevTools Protocol.

faq.question: What are the performance limits?
faq.answer: Screenshots are captured instantly. Complex pages with many elements may take 1-2 seconds to render fully.

faq.question: How does it integrate with other tools?
faq.answer: The skill outputs file paths and text that can be used in bash scripts, CI/CD pipelines, or other testing frameworks.

faq.question: Is my browsing data safe?
faq.answer: The skill runs locally on your machine. No data is sent to external servers. Use --fresh flag for isolated testing.

faq.question: Why am I getting connection refused errors?
faq.answer: Run browser-start.js first to launch Chrome with debugging. The browser must be running before other commands work.

faq.question: How is this different from Playwright or Cypress?
faq.answer: This skill provides lightweight browser automation without requiring test framework setup. Best for quick checks and documentation.
